content: this crochet pattern is free to view online on my website here https //hookedonpatterns com/crochet-blog/free-tabletop-christmas-tree-crochet-pattern the tabletop christmas tree pdf pattern is available to download for a small price it includes high quality step by step photographs you will also receive an image-free printer friendly copy written using us crochet terms with a conversion chart to help with converting into uk terms decorate your home with some beautiful tabletop christmas trees this festive season these christmas trees are worked from the top down and can be made to any height they are constructed as hollow cones so no stuffing is required i have given full pattern instructions to make a 1ft tall tree with a base diameter of 5 inches using chunky/ bulky weight yarn and a 5mm hook i have also given the formula to keep growing your tree to make any height you like you can also stop earlier to make smaller trees you can use any yarn weight you prefer with a hook size 1mm smaller than recommended on the label to make any sized tree using aran/worsted weight yarn with a 4mm hook will produce a tree approx 9 tall with a base diameter of 4 following the same 1ft pattern you can leave them plain or decorate them with fairy lights ribbons mini tinsel button or charms for a more festive look gauge exact gauge isn t too important you just want to keep your stitches compact using 1mm hook size smaller than recommended on your yarn label to make the tree cone sturdy enough to stand up on its own as a guide my gauge measures 2 square = 8 half_double_crochet x 2 pattern repeats 8 rounds using chunky yarn and a 5mm hook you will need your choice of yarn - to work the full 1ft 12 tree pattern in chunky/bulky weight yarn you ll need approx 200yds allow extra if you intend on adding more repeats to make a taller tree working the same 1ft pattern in aran/worsted weight yarn to make a 9 tree will require approx 150 yds a 5mm hook for chunky/bulky yarn or hook 1mm smaller than recommended on your yarn label yarn needle scissors optional extras battery powered fairy lights 2m copper wire led lights work well ribbon buttons or charms
